[Rich API](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ã¨ã€ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã®å‡ºåŠ›ã«è‰²ã‚„ã‚¹ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ç°¡å˜ã«è¿½åŠ ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ Richã¯ãã‚Œã„ãªãƒ†ãƒ¼ãƒ–ãƒ«ã€ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼ã€ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ã€ã‚·ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹ãƒã‚¤ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒˆã•ã‚ŒãŸã‚½ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã€ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ãªã©ã‚’ã™ãã«ç”Ÿæˆãƒ»è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚‚ã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚

![æ©Ÿèƒ½](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/features.png)

Richã®ç´¹ä»‹å‹•ç”»ã¯ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã‚’ã”è¦§ãã ã•ã„ã€‚ [calmcode.io](https://calmcode.io/rich/introduction.html) by [@fishnets88](https://twitter.com/fishnets88).

[Richã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã®äººã€…ã®æ„Ÿæƒ³ã‚’è¦‹ã‚‹ã€‚](https://www.willmcgugan.com/blog/pages/post/rich-tweets/)

## äº’æ›æ€§

Richã¯Linuxã€OSXã€Windowsã«å¯¾å¿œã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚True colorã¨çµµæ–‡å­—ã¯æ–°ã—ã„ Windows ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã§å‹•ä½œã—ã¾ã™ãŒã€å¤ã„ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã§ã¯8è‰²ã«åˆ¶é™ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚Richã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯Pythonã®ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ã¯3.6.3ä»¥é™ãŒå¿…è¦ã§ã™ã€‚

Richã¯è¿½åŠ ã®è¨­å®šã‚’è¡Œã‚ãšã¨ã‚‚ã€[Jupyter notebooks](https://jupyter.org/)ã§å‹•ä½œã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

## ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«

`pip` ã‚„ã€ã‚ãªãŸã®ãŠæ°—ã«å…¥ã‚Šã®PyPIãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ£ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚

```sh
python -m pip install rich
```

ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã—ã¦ã€ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã§ãƒªãƒƒãƒã®å‡ºåŠ›ã‚’ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã§ãã¾ã™:

```sh
python -m rich
```

## Richã®printé–¢æ•°

ç°¡å˜ã«ãƒªãƒƒãƒãªå‡ºåŠ›ã‚’ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã«è¿½åŠ ã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ã€Pythonã®çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã¿é–¢æ•°ã¨åŒã˜åå‰ã‚’æŒã¤ [rich print](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/introduction.html#quick-start) ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§å®Ÿç¾ã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã‚’è©¦ã—ã¦ã¿ã¦ãã ã•ã„:

```python
from rich import print

print("Hello, [bold magenta]World[/bold magenta]!", ":vampire:", locals())
```

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/print.png)

## Rich REPL

Richã¯Pythonã®REPLã§ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒ«ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã€ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿æ§‹é€ ãŒãã‚Œã„ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã€ãƒã‚¤ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒˆã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚

```python
>>> from rich import pretty
>>> pretty.install()
```

![REPL](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/repl.png)

## Rich Inspect

Richã«ã¯Pythonã‚ªãƒ–ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚„ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹ã€ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚¹ã€çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã¿é–¢æ•°ãªã©ã«é–¢ã™ã‚‹ãƒ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚’ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã‚‹ã€[inspecté–¢æ•°](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/init.html?highlight=inspect#rich.inspect)ãŒã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

```python
>>> from rich import inspect
>>> inspect(str, methods=True)
```

## Consoleã®ä½¿ã„æ–¹

ãƒªãƒƒãƒãªã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒ³ãƒ„ã‚’ã‚ˆã‚Šåˆ¶å¾¡ã—ã¦ã„ãã«ã¯ã€[Console](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console) ã‚ªãƒ–ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚’ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã¦æ§‹ç¯‰ã—ã¦ã„ãã¾ã™ã€‚


```python
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
```

Console ã‚ªãƒ–ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã«ã¯ `print` ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ãŒã‚ã‚Šã€ã“ã‚Œã¯çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã¿é–¢æ•°ã® `print` ã¨æ„å›³çš„ã«ä¼¼ãŸã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ•ã‚§ã‚¤ã‚¹ã‚’æŒã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
ä»¥ä¸‹ã«ä½¿ç”¨ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!")
```

ã‚ãªãŸãŒäºˆæƒ³ã—ãŸé€šã‚Šã€ã“ã‚Œã¯ `"Hello World!"` ã‚’ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã¿é–¢æ•°ã® `print` ã¨ã¯ç•°ãªã‚Šã€Rich ã¯ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã®å¹…ã«åˆã‚ã›ã¦ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã«æ³¨æ„ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚

å‡ºåŠ›çµæœã«è‰²ã‚„ã‚¹ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è¿½åŠ ã™ã‚‹æ–¹æ³•ã¯ã„ãã¤ã‹ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚­ãƒ¼ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ‰å¼•æ•°ã« `style` ã‚’è¿½åŠ ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§ã€å‡ºåŠ›çµæœå…¨ä½“ã®ã‚¹ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è¨­å®šã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã«ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!", style="bold red")
```

ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ã«å‡ºåŠ›ã•ã‚Œã¾ã™:

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/hello_world.png)

ã“ã®æ–¹æ³•ã¯ä¸€è¡Œã®ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’ä¸€åº¦ã«ã‚¹ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ã™ã‚‹ã®ã«é©ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
ã‚ˆã‚Šç´°ã‹ãã‚¹ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°ã‚’è¡Œã†ãŸã‚ã«ã€Richã¯[bbcode](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBCode)ã«ä¼¼ãŸæ§‹æ–‡ã®ç‰¹åˆ¥ãªãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚
ã“ã‚Œã¯ãã®ä¾‹ã§ã™:

```python
console.print("Where there is a [bold cyan]Will[/bold cyan] there [u]is[/u] a [i]way[/i].")
```

![Console Markup](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/where_there_is_a_will.png)

### Console logging

Consoleã‚ªãƒ–ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã«ã¯ `log()` ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ãŒã‚ã‚Šã€ã“ã‚Œã¯ `print()` ã¨åŒã˜ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ•ã‚§ã‚¤ã‚¹ã‚’æŒã¡ã¾ã™ãŒã€ç¾åœ¨ã®æ™‚åˆ»ã¨å‘¼ã³å‡ºã—ã‚’è¡Œã£ãŸãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¨è¡Œæ•°ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã‚‚ã‚«ãƒ©ãƒ ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆã§ã¯ã€Richã¯Pythonã®æ§‹é€ ä½“ã¨repræ–‡å­—åˆ—ã®ã‚·ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹ãƒã‚¤ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒˆã‚’è¡Œã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚‚ã—ã‚³ãƒ¬ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³(ä¾‹: dictã‚„list)ã‚’ãƒ­ã‚°ã«è¨˜éŒ²ã—ãŸå ´åˆã€Richã¯ãã‚Œã‚’åˆ©ç”¨å¯èƒ½ãªã‚¹ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¹ã«åã¾ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ãã‚Œã„ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã«ã€ã“ã‚Œã‚‰ã®æ©Ÿèƒ½ã®ã„ãã¤ã‹ã®ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

```python
from rich.console import Console
console = Console()

test_data = [
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "sum", "params": [None, 1, 2, 4, False, True], "id": "1",},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "notify_hello", "params": [7]},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "subtract", "params": [42, 23], "id": "2"},
]

def test_log():
    enabled = False
    context = {
        "foo": "bar",
    }
    movies = ["Deadpool", "Rise of the Skywalker"]
    console.log("Hello from", console, "!")
    console.log(test_data, log_locals=True)


test_log()
```

ä¸Šã®ä¾‹ã§ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå‡ºåŠ›ãŒå¾—ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã™:

![Log](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/log.png)

`log_locals`ã¨ã„ã†å¼•æ•°ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã§ã™ãŒã€ã“ã‚Œã¯ã€logãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ãŒå‘¼ã³å‡ºã•ã‚ŒãŸãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚«ãƒ«å¤‰æ•°ã‚’å«ã‚€ãƒ†ãƒ¼ãƒ–ãƒ«ã‚’å‡ºåŠ›ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

logãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã¯ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒã®ã‚ˆã†ãªé•·æ™‚é–“ç¨¼åƒã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒªã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã®ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã¸ã®loggingã¨ã—ã¦ä½¿ç”¨ã§ãã¾ã™ãŒã€ãƒ‡ãƒãƒƒã‚°æ™‚ã«éå¸¸ã«å½¹ã«ç«‹ã¤æ‰‹æ®µã§ã‚‚ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

### Logging Handler

ã¾ãŸã€å†…è”µã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹[Handler class](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/logging.html)ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã¦ã€Pythonã®loggingãƒ¢ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‹ã‚‰ã®å‡ºåŠ›ã‚’ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆã—ãŸã‚Šã€è‰²ä»˜ã‘ã—ãŸã‚Šã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‚‚ã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã«å‡ºåŠ›ã®ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

![Logging](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/logging.png)

## çµµæ–‡å­—(Emoji)

ã‚³ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®å‡ºåŠ›ã«çµµæ–‡å­—ã‚’æŒ¿å…¥ã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ã€2ã¤ã®ã‚³ãƒ­ãƒ³ã®é–“ã«åå‰ã‚’å…¥ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™:

```python
>>> console.print(":smiley: :vampire: :pile_of_poo: :thumbs_up: :raccoon:")
ğŸ˜ƒ ğŸ§› ğŸ’© ğŸ‘ ğŸ¦
```

ã“ã®æ©Ÿèƒ½ã‚’ã†ã¾ãæ´»ç”¨ã—ã¦ã¿ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚

## ãƒ†ãƒ¼ãƒ–ãƒ«

Richã¯ãƒ¦ãƒ‹ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã®æ ã‚’ç”¨ã„ã¦æŸ”è»Ÿã«[ãƒ†ãƒ¼ãƒ–ãƒ«](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tables.html)ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ ç½«ç·šã€ã‚¹ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ«ã€ã‚»ãƒ«ã®é…ç½®ãªã©ã®æ›¸å¼è¨­å®šã®ãŸã‚ã®ã‚ªãƒ—ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ãŒè±Šå¯Œã«ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

![table movie](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table_movie.gif)

ä¸Šã®ã‚¢ãƒ‹ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã¯ã€examplesãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®[table_movie.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/table_movie.py)ã§ç”Ÿæˆã—ãŸã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚

ã‚‚ã†å°‘ã—ç°¡å˜ãªè¡¨ã®ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.table import Table

console = Console()

table = Table(show_header=True, header_style="bold magenta")
table.add_column("Date", style="dim", width=12)
table.add_column("Title")
table.add_column("Production Budget", justify="right")
table.add_column("Box Office", justify="right")
table.add_row(
    "Dec 20, 2019", "Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker", "$275,000,000", "$375,126,118"
)
table.add_row(
    "May 25, 2018",
    "[red]Solo[/red]: A Star Wars Story",
    "$275,000,000",
    "$393,151,347",
)
table.add_row(
    "Dec 15, 2017",
    "Star Wars Ep. VIII: The Last Jedi",
    "$262,000,000",
    "[bold]$1,332,539,889[/bold]",
)

console.print(table)
```

ã“ã‚Œã«ã‚ˆã‚Šã€ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå‡ºåŠ›ãŒå¾—ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã™:

![table](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table.png)

ã‚³ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒ«ä¸Šã§ã®ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ã¯`print()` ã‚„ `log()` ã¨åŒã˜ã‚ˆã†ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã‚‹ã“ã¨ã«æ³¨æ„ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚å®Ÿéš›ã«ã¯ã€Rich ãŒè¡¨ç¤ºå¯èƒ½ãªã‚‚ã®ã¯ã™ã¹ã¦ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ã‚„è¡Œã«å«ã‚ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ (ãã‚ŒãŒä»–ã®ãƒ†ãƒ¼ãƒ–ãƒ«ã§ã‚ã£ã¦ã‚‚ã€ã§ã™)ã€‚

`Table`ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹ã¯ã€ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã®åˆ©ç”¨å¯èƒ½ãªå¹…ã«åˆã‚ã›ã¦ã‚«ãƒ©ãƒ ã®ã‚µã‚¤ã‚ºã‚’å¤‰æ›´ã—ãŸã‚Šã€å¿…è¦ã«å¿œã˜ã¦ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’æŠ˜ã‚Šè¿”ã—ãŸã‚Šã™ã‚‹ã®ã«ååˆ†ãªã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã•ã‚’æŒã£ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚
ã“ã‚Œã¯å…ˆã»ã©ã¨åŒã˜ä¾‹ã§ã€ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã‚’ä¸Šã®ãƒ†ãƒ¼ãƒ–ãƒ«ã‚ˆã‚Šã‚‚å°ã•ãã—ãŸã‚‚ã®ã§ã™ã€‚

![table2](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table2.png)

## ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼

Richã§ã¯è¤‡æ•°ã®ã¡ã‚‰ã¤ãã®ãªã„ã®[ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/progress.html)ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¦ã€é•·æ™‚é–“ã®ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ã‚’è¿½è·¡ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚

åŸºæœ¬çš„ãªä½¿ã„æ–¹ã¨ã—ã¦ã¯ã€ä»»æ„ã®ã‚·ãƒ¼ã‚±ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚’ `track` é–¢æ•°ã§ãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—ã—ã€ãã®çµæœã‚’ç¹°ã‚Šè¿”ã—å‡¦ç†ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã«ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™:

```python
from rich.progress import track

for step in track(range(100)):
    do_step(step)
```

è¤‡æ•°ã®ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼ã‚’è¿½åŠ ã™ã‚‹ã®ã¯ãã‚Œã»ã©å¤§å¤‰ã§ã¯ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã¯ãƒ‰ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆã‹ã‚‰æŠœç²‹ã—ãŸä¾‹ã§ã™:

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/progress.gif)

ã‚«ãƒ©ãƒ ã«ã¯ä»»æ„ã®è©³ç´°ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«è¨­å®šã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚çµ„ã¿è¾¼ã¾ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚«ãƒ©ãƒ ã«ã¯ã€å®Œäº†ç‡ã€ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚µã‚¤ã‚ºã€ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«é€Ÿåº¦ã€æ®‹ã‚Šæ™‚é–“ãŒå«ã¾ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã“ã§ã¯ã€é€²è¡Œä¸­ã®ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹åˆ¥ã®ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™:

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/downloader.gif)

ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã‚’è‡ªåˆ†ã§è©¦ã—ã¦è¦‹ã‚‹ã«ã¯ã€é€²æ—çŠ¶æ³ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã—ãªãŒã‚‰è¤‡æ•°ã®URLã‚’åŒæ™‚ã«ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã§ãã‚‹ [examples/downloader.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/downloader.py) ã‚’å‚ç…§ã—ã¦ã¿ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚

## ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹

é€²æ—çŠ¶æ³ã‚’è¨ˆç®—ã™ã‚‹ã®ãŒé›£ã—ã„å ´åˆã¯ã€[status](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console.status)ãƒ¡ã‚½ãƒƒãƒ‰ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ã¦ã€ã€Œã‚¹ãƒ”ãƒŠãƒ¼ã€ã‚¢ãƒ‹ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã¨ãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã›ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚é€šå¸¸ã€ã‚¢ãƒ‹ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã¯ã‚³ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®ä½¿ç”¨ã‚’å¦¨ã’ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã¯ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚ã“ã“ã«ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™:

```python
from time import sleep
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
tasks = [f"task {n}" for n in range(1, 11)]

with console.status("[bold green]Working on tasks...") as status:
    while tasks:
        task = tasks.pop(0)
        sleep(1)
        console.log(f"{task} complete")
```

ã“ã‚Œã«ã‚ˆã‚Šã€ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã«ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå‡ºåŠ›ãŒç”Ÿæˆã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚

![status](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/status.gif)

ã‚¹ãƒ”ãƒŠãƒ¼ã®ã‚¢ãƒ‹ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã¯ [cli-spinners](https://www.npmjs.com/package/cli-spinners) ã‹ã‚‰æ‹å€Ÿã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚`spinner`ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’æŒ‡å®šã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§ã‚¹ãƒ”ãƒŠãƒ¼ã‚’é¸æŠã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã—ã¦ã€åˆ©ç”¨å¯èƒ½ãªå€¤ã‚’ç¢ºèªã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„:

```
python -m rich.spinner
```

ä¸Šè¨˜ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã¯ã€ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«ã§ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå‡ºåŠ›ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã—ã¾ã™:

![spinners](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/spinners.gif)

## ãƒ„ãƒªãƒ¼

Richã¯ã‚¬ã‚¤ãƒ‰ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ³ä»˜ãã®[ãƒ„ãƒªãƒ¼](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tree.html)ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ãƒ„ãƒªãƒ¼ã¯ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«æ§‹é€ ãªã©ã®éšå±¤ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã®ã«é©ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

ãƒ„ãƒªãƒ¼ã®ãƒ©ãƒ™ãƒ«ã¯ã€ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ãªãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚„ã€RichãŒè¡¨ç¤ºã§ãã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã§ã‚ã‚Œã°ä½•ã§ã‚‚è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã—ã¦ãƒ‡ãƒ¢ã‚’è¡Œã„ã¾ã™:

```
python -m rich.tree
```

ã“ã‚Œã«ã‚ˆã‚Šã€æ¬¡ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå‡ºåŠ›ãŒç”Ÿæˆã•ã‚Œã¾ã™:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/tree.png)

linuxã® `tree` ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã¨åŒæ§˜ã«ã€ä»»æ„ã®ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®ãƒ„ãƒªãƒ¼è¡¨ç¤ºã‚’è¡Œã†ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã¯ã€[tree.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/tree.py)ã®ä¾‹ã‚’å‚ç…§ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚

## ã‚«ãƒ©ãƒ 

Rich ã¯ã€ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ†ãƒ³ãƒ„ã‚’ãã‚Œã„ãª [ã‚«ãƒ©ãƒ ](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/columns.html) ã§ç­‰å¹…ã€ã¾ãŸã¯æœ€é©ãªå¹…ã§è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã¯(MacOS / Linux) ã® `ls` ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã®ã¨ã¦ã‚‚åŸºæœ¬çš„ãªã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã§ã€ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªä¸€è¦§ã‚’ã‚«ãƒ©ãƒ ã§è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚

```python
import os
import sys

from rich import print
from rich.columns import Columns

directory = os.listdir(sys.argv[1])
print(Columns(directory))
```

ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒƒãƒˆã¯ã€APIã‹ã‚‰å¼•ã£å¼µã£ã¦ããŸãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ã‚«ãƒ©ãƒ ã§è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹[columns example](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/columns.py)ã«ã‚ˆã‚‹å‡ºåŠ›ã§ã™:

![columns](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/columns.png)

## ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³

Richã¯[ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/markdown.html)ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã€ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆã‚’ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒŸãƒŠãƒ«å‘ã‘ã«å¤‰æ›ã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®è‰¯ã„ä»•äº‹ã‚’ã—ã¦ãã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚

ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ã€`Markdown`ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹ã‚’ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã—ã€ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’å«ã‚€æ–‡å­—åˆ—ã§æ§‹æˆã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ãã—ã¦ãã‚Œã‚’ã‚³ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã¯ä¾‹ã§ã™:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.markdown import Markdown

console = Console()
with open("README.md") as readme:
    markdown = Markdown(readme.read())
console.print(markdown)
```

ã“ã‚Œã«ã‚ˆã‚Šã€ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå‡ºåŠ›ãŒå¾—ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã™:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/markdown.png)

## ã‚·ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹ãƒã‚¤ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒˆ

Richã¯ [ã‚·ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¹ãƒã‚¤ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒˆ](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/syntax.html) ã‚’å®Ÿè£…ã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã« [pygments](https://pygments.org/) ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ä½¿ã„æ–¹ã¯ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ã®ã¨ä¼¼ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ `Syntax` ã‚ªãƒ–ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚’æ§‹ç¯‰ã—ã¦ã‚³ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ä»¥ä¸‹ã«ãã®ä¾‹ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.syntax import Syntax

my_code = '''
def iter_first_last(values: Iterable[T]) -> Iterable[Tuple[bool, bool, T]]:
    """Iterate and generate a tuple with a flag for first and last value."""
    iter_values = iter(values)
    try:
        previous_value = next(iter_values)
    except StopIteration:
        return
    first = True
    for value in iter_values:
        yield first, False, previous_value
        first = False
        previous_value = value
    yield first, True, previous_value
'''
syntax = Syntax(my_code, "python", theme="monokai", line_numbers=True)
console = Console()
console.print(syntax)
```

ã“ã‚Œã«ã‚ˆã‚Šã€ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªå‡ºåŠ›ãŒå¾—ã‚‰ã‚Œã¾ã™:

![syntax](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/syntax.png)

## ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒãƒƒã‚¯

Rich ã¯ [ç¾ã—ã„ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒãƒƒã‚¯](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/traceback.html) ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã€é€šå¸¸ã®Pythonã®ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚ˆã‚Šã‚‚èª­ã¿ã‚„ã™ãã€ã‚ˆã‚Šå¤šãã®ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¾ã™ã€‚Richã‚’ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆã®ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ©ã¨ã—ã¦è¨­å®šã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§ã€æ•æ‰ã•ã‚Œãªã‹ã£ãŸä¾‹å¤–ã¯ã™ã¹ã¦Richã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚

OSXã§ã¯ã“ã®ã‚ˆã†ãªè¡¨ç¤ºã¨ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ï¼ˆLinuxã§ã‚‚ä¼¼ãŸã‚ˆã†ãªè¡¨ç¤ºã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã™ï¼‰:

![traceback](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/traceback.png)

## Richã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ãŸãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆ

ã“ã“ã§ã¯ã€Richã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ãŸã„ãã¤ã‹ã®ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚’ç´¹ä»‹ã—ã¾ã™:

  3æ¬¡å…ƒã®ç¥çµŒè§£å‰–å­¦çš„ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’å¯è¦–åŒ–ã™ã‚‹pythonãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸

  ã“ã®ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã¯ã€ä¸€èˆ¬çš„ãªè„†å¼±æ€§ã®ã‚ã‚‹ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ãƒˆ(openssl, libpng, libxml2, expat, ãã®ä»–ã„ãã¤ã‹)ã‚’ã‚¹ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ³ã—ã€ãŠä½¿ã„ã®ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ ã«æ—¢çŸ¥ã®è„†å¼±æ€§ã®ã‚ã‚‹ä¸€èˆ¬çš„ãªãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªãŒå«ã¾ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‹ã©ã†ã‹ã‚’çŸ¥ã‚‰ã›ã¦ãã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚

RichëŠ” í„°ë¯¸ë„ì—ì„œ _í’ë¶€í•œ(rich)_ í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ì™€ ì•„ë¦„ë‹¤ìš´ ì„œì‹ì„ ì§€ì›í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•œ íŒŒì´ì¬ ë¼ì´ë¸ŒëŸ¬ë¦¬ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤.

[Rich API](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)ëŠ” í„°ë¯¸ë„ ì¶œë ¥ì— ìƒ‰ê¹”ê³¼ ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼ì„ ì…íˆê¸° ì‰½ê²Œ ë„ì™€ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë˜í•œ RichëŠ” ë³„ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì„¤ì • ì—†ì´ í‘œ, ì§„í–‰ ë°”, ë§ˆí¬ë‹¤ìš´, ì†ŒìŠ¤ì½”ë“œ êµ¬ë¬¸ ê°•ì¡°, tracebacks ë“±ì„ ì˜ˆì˜ê²Œ ë³´ì—¬ì¤„ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

![Features](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/features.png)

Richì— ëŒ€í•œ ë™ì˜ìƒ ì„¤ëª…ì„ ë³´ì‹œë ¤ë©´ [@fishnets88](https://twitter.com/fishnets88)ì˜ [calmcode.io](https://calmcode.io/rich/introduction.html)ë¥¼ í™•ì¸ ë°”ëë‹ˆë‹¤.

[ì‚¬ëŒë“¤ì˜ Richì— ëŒ€í•œ ì˜ê²¬](https://www.willmcgugan.com/blog/pages/post/rich-tweets/)ì„ í™•ì¸í•´ë³´ì„¸ìš”.

## í˜¸í™˜ì„±

RichëŠ” ë¦¬ëˆ…ìŠ¤, OSX, ìœˆë„ìš°ì—ì„œ ë™ì‘í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. íŠ¸ë£¨ ì»¬ëŸ¬ / ì´ëª¨ì§€ëŠ” ìƒˆë¡œìš´ ìœˆë„ìš° í„°ë¯¸ë„ì—ì„œ ë™ì‘í•˜ì§€ë§Œ êµ¬í˜• í„°ë¯¸ë„ì—ì„œëŠ” 16ê°€ì§€ ìƒ‰ìœ¼ë¡œ ì œí•œë©ë‹ˆë‹¤. RichëŠ” íŒŒì´ì¬ 3.6.3 ë²„ì „ í˜¹ì€ ê·¸ ì´í›„ ë²„ì „ì´ í•„ìš”í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

RichëŠ” [Jupyter notebooks](https://jupyter.org/)ì—ì„œ ë³„ë„ì˜ ì„¤ì •ì—†ì´ ë°”ë¡œ ë™ì‘í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

## ì„¤ì¹˜

`pip` ë˜ëŠ” ì¢‹ì•„í•˜ëŠ” PyPI íŒ¨í‚¤ì§€ ë§¤ë‹ˆì €ë¡œ ì„¤ì¹˜í•˜ì„¸ìš”.

```sh
python -m pip install rich
```

ì•„ë˜ ëª…ë ¹ì–´ë¥¼ í†µí•´ í„°ë¯¸ë„ì—ì„œ Rich ì¶œë ¥ì„ í…ŒìŠ¤íŠ¸í•´ë³´ì„¸ìš”.

```sh
python -m rich
```

## Rich Print

ê°„ë‹¨í•˜ê²Œ ë‹¹ì‹ ì˜ ì–´í”Œë¦¬ì¼€ì´ì…˜ì— richí•œ ì¶œë ¥ì„ ì¶”ê°€í•˜ë ¤ë©´, íŒŒì´ì¬ ë‚´ì¥ í•¨ìˆ˜ì™€ signatureê°€ ê°™ì€ [rich print](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/introduction.html#quick-start) ë©”ì„œë“œë¥¼ import í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.
ë”°ë¼í•´ë³´ì„¸ìš”:

```python
from rich import print

print("Hello, [bold magenta]World[/bold magenta]!", ":vampire:", locals())
```

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/print.png)

## Rich REPL

RichëŠ” íŒŒì´ì¬ REPLì—ë„ ì„¤ì¹˜í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì–´ë–¤ ë°ì´í„° êµ¬ì¡°ë¼ë„ ì˜ˆì˜ê²Œ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ê±°ë‚˜ ê°•ì¡°í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

```python
>>> from rich import pretty
>>> pretty.install()
```

![REPL](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/repl.png)

## ì½˜ì†” ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ê¸°

rich í„°ë¯¸ë„ì„ ë”ìš± ì˜ í™œìš©í•˜ë ¤ë©´, import í•œ ë’¤ [Console](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console) ê°ì²´ë¥¼ ìƒì„±í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”.

```python
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
```

ì½˜ì†” ê°ì²´ì—ëŠ” `print` ë©”ì„œë“œê°€ ìˆëŠ”ë°, ë‚´ë¶€ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ë‚´ì¥ `print` í•¨ìˆ˜ì™€ ìœ ì‚¬í•œ ì¸í„°í˜ì´ìŠ¤ë¥¼ ê°€ì§€ê³  ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì•„ë˜ëŠ” ì˜ˆì œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!")
```

ì˜ˆìƒëŒ€ë¡œ `"Hello World!"`ì´ í„°ë¯¸ë„ì— ì¶œë ¥ë  ê²ƒì…ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‚´ì¥ `print` í•¨ìˆ˜ì™€ ë‹¬ë¦¬, RichëŠ” í„°ë¯¸ë„ í­ì— ë§ì¶° ìë™ ì¤„ë°”ê¿ˆ(word-wrap)ì„ ì ìš©í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì— ìœ ì˜í•˜ì„¸ìš”.

ì¶œë ¥ì— ìƒ‰ê¹”ê³¼ ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼ì„ ì…íˆëŠ” ë°©ë²•ì€ ëª‡ê°€ì§€ê°€ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. `style` í‚¤ì›Œë“œ ì „ë‹¬ì¸ìë¥¼ ì¶”ê°€í•´ ì „ì²´ ì¶œë ¥ì— ëŒ€í•´ ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼ì„ ë³€ê²½í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì˜ˆì œëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!", style="bold red")
```

ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ì´ ì¶œë ¥ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/hello_world.png)

í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ í•œ ì¤„ì„ í•œ ë²ˆì— ìˆ˜ì •í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒë„ ì¢‹ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ë”ìš± ì„¸ì„¸í•˜ê²Œ ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼ì„ ë³€ê²½í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´, RichëŠ” [bbcode](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBCode)ì™€ êµ¬ë¬¸ì´ ë¹„ìŠ·í•œ ë³„ë„ì˜ ë§ˆí¬ì—…ì„ ë Œë”ë§ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì˜ˆì œëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

```python
console.print("Where there is a [bold cyan]Will[/bold cyan] there [u]is[/u] a [i]way[/i].")
```

![Console Markup](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/where_there_is_a_will.png)

Console ê°ì²´ë¥¼ í™œìš©í•´ ì ì€ ë…¸ë ¥ìœ¼ë¡œ ë³µì¡í•œ ì¶œë ¥ì„ ì†ì‰½ê²Œ ë§Œë“¤ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ìì„¸í•œ ë‚´ìš©ì€ [Console API](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/console.html) ë¬¸ì„œë¥¼ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”.

## Rich Inspect

RichëŠ” classë‚˜ instance, builtin ê°™ì€ íŒŒì´ì¬ ê°ì²´ì˜ ë ˆí¬íŠ¸ë¥¼ ìƒì„±í•˜ëŠ” [inspect](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/init.html?highlight=inspect#rich.inspect) í•¨ìˆ˜ë¥¼ í¬í•¨í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤

```python
>>> my_list = ["foo", "bar"]
>>> from rich import inspect
>>> inspect(my_list, methods=True)
```

![Log](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/inspect.png)

ìì„¸í•œ ë‚´ìš©ì€ [inspect docs](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/init.html#rich.inspect) ë¬¸ì„œë¥¼ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”.

# Rich Library

RichëŠ” CLIì—ì„œ ìš°ì•„í•˜ê²Œ ì¶œë ¥í•˜ê±°ë‚˜ ì½”ë“œ ë””ë²„ê¹…ì„ ë•ë„ë¡ ë‹¤ì–‘í•œ ë¹ŒíŠ¸ì¸ _ë Œë”ë§ì„_ í¬í•¨í•˜ê³  ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ìì„¸í•œ ë‚´ìš©ì„ í™•ì¸í•˜ë ¤ë©´ ì œëª©ì„ ëˆŒëŸ¬ì£¼ì„¸ìš”:

<details>
<summary>Log</summary>

Console ê°ì²´ëŠ” `print()`ì™€ ì¸í„°í˜ì´ìŠ¤ê°€ ìœ ì‚¬í•œ `log()` ë©”ì„œë“œë¥¼ ê°€ì§€ê³  ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. `Log()`ëŠ” í˜¸ì¶œì´ ì´ë£¨ì–´ì§„ íŒŒì¼ê³¼ ë¼ì¸, í˜„ì¬ ì‹œê°„ë„ ê°™ì´ ì¶œë ¥í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ê¸°ë³¸ì ìœ¼ë¡œ RichëŠ” íŒŒì´ì¬ êµ¬ì¡°ì²´ì™€ repr stringì— ëŒ€í•´ ì‹ íƒìŠ¤ í•˜ì´ë¼ì´íŒ…ì„ ì§€ì›í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë§Œì•½ ë‹¹ì‹ ì´ collection(ì˜ˆë¥¼ ë“¤ì–´ dictë‚˜ list)ì„ ë¡œê¹…í•œë‹¤ë©´, RichëŠ” í‘œí˜„ ê°€ëŠ¥í•œ ê³µê°„ì— ë§ì¶° ì˜ˆì˜ê²Œ ì¶œë ¥í•´ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì´ëŸ¬í•œ ê¸°ëŠ¥ë“¤ì— ëŒ€í•œ ì˜ˆì‹œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
from rich.console import Console
console = Console()

test_data = [
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "sum", "params": [None, 1, 2, 4, False, True], "id": "1",},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "notify_hello", "params": [7]},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "subtract", "params": [42, 23], "id": "2"},
]

def test_log():
    enabled = False
    context = {
        "foo": "bar",
    }
    movies = ["Deadpool", "Rise of the Skywalker"]
    console.log("Hello from", console, "!")
    console.log(test_data, log_locals=True)


test_log()
```

ìœ„ ì½”ë“œì˜ ì‹¤í–‰ ê²°ê³¼ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤:

![Log](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/log.png)

`log_locals` ì¸ìë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ë©´ log ë©”ì„œë“œê°€ í˜¸ì¶œëœ ê³³ì˜ ë¡œì»¬ ë³€ìˆ˜ë“¤ì„ í‘œë¡œ ë³´ì—¬ì¤€ë‹¤ëŠ” ê²ƒë„ ì•Œì•„ë‘ì„¸ìš”.

ë¡œê·¸ ë©”ì„œë“œëŠ” ì„œë²„ì²˜ëŸ¼ ì˜¤ë«ë™ì•ˆ ì‹¤í–‰ë˜ëŠ” ì–´í”Œë¦¬ì¼€ì´ì…˜ì„ í„°ë¯¸ë„ë¡œ ë¡œê¹…í• ë•Œ ì‚¬ìš©í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆì§€ë§Œ ë””ë²„ê¹… í•  ë•Œë„ ë§¤ìš° ì¢‹ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

</details>
<details>
<summary>Logging Handler</summary>

ë˜í•œ ë‚´ì¥ëœ [Handler class](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/logging.html)ë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•´ íŒŒì´ì¬ì˜ ë¡œê¹… ëª¨ë“ˆì˜ ì¶œë ¥ì„ í˜•íƒœë¥¼ ê¾¸ë¯¸ê±°ë‚˜ ìƒ‰ì„ ì…í ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‹¤ìŒì€ ì˜ˆì œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![Logging](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/logging.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Emoji(ì´ëª¨ì§€)</summary>

ì½˜ì†” ì¶œë ¥ì— ì´ëª¨ì§€ë¥¼ ë„£ìœ¼ë ¤ë©´ ë‘ ì½œë¡ (:) ì‚¬ì´ì— ì´ëª¨ì§€ ì´ë¦„ì„ ë„£ì–´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”. ë‹¤ìŒì€ ì˜ˆì œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
>>> console.print(":smiley: :vampire: :pile_of_poo: :thumbs_up: :raccoon:")
ğŸ˜ƒ ğŸ§› ğŸ’© ğŸ‘ ğŸ¦
```

ë¶€ë”” ì´ ê¸°ëŠ¥ì„ ì˜ ì‚¬ìš©í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tables(í‘œ)</summary>

RichëŠ” ìœ ë‹ˆì½”ë“œ ë°•ìŠ¤ ë¬¸ìì™€ í•¨ê»˜ [í‘œ](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tables.html)ë¥¼ ììœ ë¡­ê²Œ ë Œë”ë§í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ê°€ì¥ìë¦¬, ìŠ¤íƒ€ì¼, ì…€ ì •ë ¬ ë“±ì„ ì •ë§ ë‹¤ì–‘í•˜ê²Œ êµ¬ì„±í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

![table movie](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table_movie.gif)

ìœ„ì˜ ì• ë‹ˆë©”ì´ì…˜ì€ example ë””ë ‰í† ë¦¬ì˜ [table_movie.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/table_movie.py)ë¡œ ìƒì„±ë˜ì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ë” ê°„ë‹¨í•œ í‘œ ì˜ˆì œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.table import Table

console = Console()

table = Table(show_header=True, header_style="bold magenta")
table.add_column("Date", style="dim", width=12)
table.add_column("Title")
table.add_column("Production Budget", justify="right")
table.add_column("Box Office", justify="right")
table.add_row(
    "Dec 20, 2019", "Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker", "$275,000,000", "$375,126,118"
)
table.add_row(
    "May 25, 2018",
    "[red]Solo[/red]: A Star Wars Story",
    "$275,000,000",
    "$393,151,347",
)
table.add_row(
    "Dec 15, 2017",
    "Star Wars Ep. VIII: The Last Jedi",
    "$262,000,000",
    "[bold]$1,332,539,889[/bold]",
)

console.print(table)
```

ì´ëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ì´ ì¶œë ¥ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![table](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table.png)

ì½˜ì†” ì¶œë ¥ì€ `print()`ë‚˜ `log()`ì™€ ê°™ì€ ë°©ì‹ìœ¼ë¡œ ë Œë”ë§ ëœë‹¤ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ì£¼ì˜í•˜ì„¸ìš”. ì‚¬ì‹¤, Richë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ” ê²ƒì€ ë¬´ì—‡ì´ë“  headers / rows (ì‹¬ì§€ì–´ ë‹¤ë¥¸ í‘œë“¤ë„)ì— í¬í•¨í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

`Table` í´ë˜ìŠ¤ëŠ” í„°ë¯¸ë„ì˜ í­ì— ë§ì¶° í•„ìš”í•œ ë§Œí¼ ì¤„ì„ ë‚´ë¦¬ê³  ì—´ ê¸¸ì´ë¥¼ ìŠ¤ìŠ¤ë¡œ ì¡°ì ˆí•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ìœ„ì˜ í‘œë³´ë‹¤ ì‘ì€ í„°ë¯¸ë„ì—ì„œ ë§Œë“¤ì–´ì§„ í‘œ ì˜ˆì‹œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![table2](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table2.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Progress Bars(ì§„í–‰ ë°”)</summary>

RichëŠ” ì˜¤ë˜ ê±¸ë¦¬ëŠ” ì‘ì—…ë“¤ì„ ìœ„í•´ ê¹œë¹¡ì„ ì—†ëŠ” [ì§„í–‰](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/progress.html) ë°”ë¥¼ ì—¬ëŸ¬ê°œ í‘œí˜„í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ê¸°ë³¸ì ì¸ ì‚¬ìš©ì„ ìœ„í•´ì„  ì•„ë¬´ sequenceë‚˜ `track` í•¨ìˆ˜ë¡œ ê°ì‹¸ê³  ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ ë°˜ë³µí•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”. ë‹¤ìŒì€ ì˜ˆì œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
from rich.progress import track

for step in track(range(100)):
    do_step(step)
```

ì—¬ëŸ¬ê°œì˜ ì§„í–‰ ë°”ë¥¼ ì¶”ê°€í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒë„ ì–´ë µì§€ ì•ŠìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì•„ë˜ëŠ” ê³µì‹ë¬¸ì„œì—ì„œ ë”°ì˜¨ ì˜ˆì‹œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/progress.gif)

ì¹¼ëŸ¼ë“¤ì€ ìˆ˜ì •í•´ ì›í•˜ëŠ” ì„¸ë¶€ì •ë³´ë¥¼ ë³´ì—¬ì¤„ ìˆ˜ë„ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ê¸°ë³¸ìœ¼ë¡œ ë‚´ì¥ëœ ì¹¼ëŸ¼ë“¤ì€ ì™„ë£Œ í¼ì„¼í‹°ì§€, íŒŒì¼ í¬ê¸°, íŒŒì¼ ì†ë„, ë‚¨ì€ ì‹œê°„ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‹¤ìš´ë¡œë“œ ì§„í–‰ì„ ë³´ì—¬ì£¼ëŠ” ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì˜ˆì œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/downloader.gif)

ì§ì ‘ í•´ë³´ì‹œë ¤ë©´, ì§„í–‰ ë°”ì™€ í•¨ê»˜ ì—¬ëŸ¬ê°œì˜ URLë“¤ì„ ë™ì‹œì— ë‹¤ìš´ë¡œë“œ ë°›ëŠ” ì˜ˆì œì¸ [examples/downloader.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/downloader.py)ë¥¼ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Status(ìƒíƒœ)</summary>

ì§„í–‰ ìƒí™©ì„ ê³„ì‚°í•˜ê¸° ì–´ë ¤ìš´ ê²½ìš°, [ìƒíƒœ](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console.status) ë©”ì„œë“œë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì´ ë©”ì„œë“œëŠ” 'ìŠ¤í”¼ë„ˆ' ì• ë‹ˆë©”ì´ì…˜ê³¼ ë©”ì„¸ì§€ë¥¼ í‘œì‹œí•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì• ë‹ˆë©”ì´ì…˜ì€ ë‹¹ì‹ ì´ ì½˜ì†”ì„ ì •ìƒì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ë§‰ì§€ ëª»í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‹¤ìŒì€ ì˜ˆì œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
from time import sleep
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
tasks = [f"task {n}" for n in range(1, 11)]

with console.status("[bold green]Working on tasks...") as status:
    while tasks:
        task = tasks.pop(0)
        sleep(1)
        console.log(f"{task} complete")
```

ì´ ì˜ˆì œëŠ” í„°ë¯¸ë„ì— ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ì´ ì¶œë ¥í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

![status](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/status.gif)

ìŠ¤í”¼ë„ˆ ì• ë‹ˆë©”ì´ì…˜ì€ [cli-spinners](https://www.npmjs.com/package/cli-spinners)ì—ì„œ ë¹Œë ¤ì™”ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. `spinner` íŒŒë¼ë¯¸í„°ë¥¼ ì„ íƒí•´ì„œ íŠ¹ì • ìŠ¤í”¼ë„ˆë¥¼ ì„ íƒí•  ìˆ˜ë„ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì–´ë–¤ ê°’ì„ ì„ íƒí•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ”ì§€ëŠ” ì•„ë˜ ëª…ë ¹ì–´ë¥¼ í†µí•´ í™•ì¸í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤:

```
python -m rich.spinner
```

ìœ„ì˜ ëª…ë ¹ì–´ë¥¼ ì…ë ¥í•˜ë©´ ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ì€ ì¶œë ¥ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![spinners](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/spinners.gif)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tree(íŠ¸ë¦¬)</summary>

RichëŠ” ê°€ì´ë“œë¼ì¸ê³¼ í•¨ê»˜ [íŠ¸ë¦¬](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tree.html)ë¥¼ í‘œí˜„í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. íŒŒì¼ êµ¬ì¡°ë‚˜, ê³„ì¸µì  ë°ì´í„°ë¥¼ ë³´ì—¬ì£¼ëŠ”ë° ì í•©í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

íŠ¸ë¦¬ì˜ ë¼ë²¨ì€ ê°„ë‹¨í•œ í…ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë‚˜ Richë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ” ê²ƒì€ ëª¨ë“ ì§€ ê°€ëŠ¥í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì•„ë˜ì˜ ì˜ˆì‹œë¥¼ ë”°ë¼í•´ë³´ì„¸ìš”:

```
python -m rich.tree
```

ì´ëŠ” ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ì´ ì¶œë ¥ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/tree.png)

ë¦¬ëˆ…ìŠ¤ì˜ `tree` ëª…ë ¹ì–´ì²˜ëŸ¼ ì•„ë¬´ ë””ë ‰í† ë¦¬ì˜ íŠ¸ë¦¬ë¥¼ ë³´ì—¬ì£¼ëŠ” ìŠ¤í¬ë¦½íŠ¸ ì˜ˆì œë¥¼ ë³´ì‹œë ¤ë©´ [tree.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/tree.py)ë¥¼ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Columns(ì¹¼ëŸ¼)</summary>

RichëŠ” ë‚´ìš©ì„ ê°™ê±°ë‚˜ ì ì ˆí•œ í­ìœ¼ë¡œ ê¹”ë”í•˜ê²Œ [ì¹¼ëŸ¼](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/columns.html)ì„ í‘œí˜„í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì•„ë˜ ì˜ˆì œëŠ” ì¢…ë ¬ë¡œ ë””ë ‰í† ë¦¬ ë¦¬ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¥¼ ë³´ì—¬ì£¼ëŠ” (MacOS / Linux)ì˜ `ls` ëª…ë ¹ì–´ì˜ ê¸°ë³¸ì ì¸ í´ë¡ ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
import os
import sys

from rich import print
from rich.columns import Columns

directory = os.listdir(sys.argv[1])
print(Columns(directory))
```

ì•„ë˜ ìŠ¤í¬ë¦°ìƒ·ì€ APIì—ì„œ ë½‘ì€ ë°ì´í„°ë¥¼ ì¢…ë ¬ë¡œ í‘œí˜„í•˜ëŠ” [ì¹¼ëŸ¼ ì˜ˆì œ](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/columns.py)ì˜ ì¶œë ¥ ê²°ê³¼ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![columns](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/columns.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Markdown(ë§ˆí¬ë‹¤ìš´)</summary>

RichëŠ” [ë§ˆí¬ë‹¤ìš´](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/markdown.html)ì„ í‘œí˜„í•˜ê±°ë‚˜ í˜•íƒœë¥¼ í„°ë¯¸ë„ì— ë§ì¶”ì–´ ì ì ˆíˆ ë³€í™˜í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ë§ˆí¬ë‹¤ìš´ì„ í‘œí˜„í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´ì„œëŠ” `Markdown` í´ë˜ìŠ¤ë¥¼ importí•˜ê³  ë§ˆí¬ë‹¤ìš´ì„ í¬í•¨í•˜ê³  ìˆëŠ” ë¬¸ìì—´ì„ í†µí•´ ê°ì²´ë¥¼ ìƒì„±í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”. ë‹¤ìŒì€ ì˜ˆì œì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.markdown import Markdown

console = Console()
with open("README.md") as readme:
    markdown = Markdown(readme.read())
console.print(markdown)
```

ìœ„ ì½”ë“œëŠ” ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ì€ ì¶œë ¥ ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ ë§Œë“¤ ê²ƒì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/markdown.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Syntax Highlighting(êµ¬ë¬¸ ê°•ì¡°)</summary>

RichëŠ” [êµ¬ë¬¸ ê°•ì¡°](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/syntax.html) ê¸°ëŠ¥ì„ ìˆ˜í–‰í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´ [pygments](https://pygments.org/) ë¼ì´ë¸ŒëŸ¬ë¦¬ë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì‚¬ìš©ë²•ì€ ë§ˆí¬ë‹¤ìš´ê³¼ ìœ ì‚¬í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. `Syntax` ê°ì²´ë¥¼ ìƒì„±í•˜ê³  ì½˜ì†”ì— ì¶œë ¥í•˜ì„¸ìš”. ì˜ˆì œëŠ” ë‹¤ìŒê³¼ ê°™ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.syntax import Syntax

my_code = '''
def iter_first_last(values: Iterable[T]) -> Iterable[Tuple[bool, bool, T]]:
    """Iterate and generate a tuple with a flag for first and last value."""
    iter_values = iter(values)
    try:
        previous_value = next(iter_values)
    except StopIteration:
        return
    first = True
    for value in iter_values:
        yield first, False, previous_value
        first = False
        previous_value = value
    yield first, True, previous_value
'''
syntax = Syntax(my_code, "python", theme="monokai", line_numbers=True)
console = Console()
console.print(syntax)
```

ìœ„ ì½”ë“œëŠ” ì•„ë˜ì™€ ê°™ì€ ì¶œë ¥ ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ ë§Œë“¤ ê²ƒì…ë‹ˆë‹¤:

![syntax](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/syntax.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tracebacks</summary>

RichëŠ” [ì˜ˆìœ tracebacks](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/traceback.html)ì„ í‘œí˜„í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì´ê²ƒì€ ì½ê¸°ë„ ë” ì‰½ê³  ì¼ë°˜ì ì¸ íŒŒì´ì¬ tracebacks ë³´ë‹¤ ë” ë§ì€ ì½”ë“œë¥¼ ë³´ì—¬ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. uncaught exceptionsê°€ Richë¡œ ì¶œë ¥ë˜ë„ë¡ Richë¥¼ ê¸°ë³¸ Traceback í•¸ë“¤ëŸ¬ë¡œ ì„¤ì •í•  ìˆ˜ë„ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

OSXì—ì„œëŠ” ì´ë ‡ê²Œ ì¶œë ¥ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤ (ë¦¬ëˆ…ìŠ¤ë„ ìœ ì‚¬í•¨):

![traceback](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/traceback.png)

</details>

ëª¨ë“  Richë¡œ í‘œí˜„ ê°€ëŠ¥í•œ ê²ƒë“¤ì€ [Console Protocol](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/protocol.html)ë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì´ê²ƒì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•´ì„œ ìì‹ ì˜ Rich ì»¨í…ì¸ ë¥¼ ë Œë”ë§í•  ìˆ˜ë„ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

# ì—”í„°í”„ë¼ì´ì¦ˆë¥¼ ìœ„í•œ Rich

Tidelift êµ¬ë…ì˜ ì¼í™˜ìœ¼ë¡œ ê°€ëŠ¥í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

Richë¥¼ í¬í•¨í•œ ìˆ˜ì²œê°€ì§€ ë‹¤ë¥¸ íŒ¨í‚¤ì§€ë“¤ì˜ ë©”ì¸í…Œì´ë„ˆë“¤ì€ ë‹¹ì‹ ì´ ì•±ì„ ë§Œë“¤ê¸° ìœ„í•´ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ëŠ” ì˜¤í”ˆì†ŒìŠ¤ íŒ¨í‚¤ì§€ì˜ ìƒì—…ì ì¸ ì§€ì›ê³¼ ìœ ì§€ë³´ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ìœ„í•´ Tideliftì™€ í•¨ê»˜ ì¼í•˜ê³  ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‹¹ì‹ ì´ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ëŠ” íŒ¨í‚¤ì§€ì˜ ë©”ì¸í…Œì´ë„ˆì—ê²Œ ë¹„ìš©ì„ ì§€ë¶ˆí•˜ëŠ” ëŒ€ì‹  ì‹œê°„ì„ ì ˆì•½í•˜ê³ , ë¦¬ìŠ¤í¬ë¥¼ ì¤„ì´ê³ , ì½”ë“œì˜ í’ˆì§ˆì„ í–¥ìƒì‹œí‚¬ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. [![Supported Python Versions](https://img.shields.io/pypi/pyversions/rich)](https://pypi.org/project/rich/) [![PyPI version](https://badge.fury.io/py/rich.svg)](https://badge.fury.io/py/rich)

[![Downloads](https://pepy.tech/badge/rich/month)](https://pepy.tech/project/rich)
[![codecov](https://img.shields.io/codecov/c/github/Textualize/rich?label=codecov&logo=codecov)](https://codecov.io/gh/Textualize/rich)
[![Rich blog](https://img.shields.io/badge/blog-rich%20news-yellowgreen)](https://www.willmcgugan.com/tag/rich/)
[![Twitter Follow](https://img.shields.io/twitter/follow/willmcgugan.svg?style=social)](https://twitter.com/willmcgugan)

![Logo](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/logo.svg)

[English readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.md)
 â€¢ [ç®€ä½“ä¸­æ–‡ readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.cn.md)
 â€¢ [æ­£é«”ä¸­æ–‡ readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.zh-tw.md)
 â€¢ [Lengua espaÃ±ola readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.es.md)

 â€¢ [æ—¥æœ¬èª readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.ja.md)
 â€¢ [í•œêµ­ì–´ readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.kr.md)
 â€¢ [FranÃ§ais readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.fr.md)
 â€¢ [SchwizerdÃ¼tsch readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.de-ch.md)
 â€¢ [à¤¹à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥€ readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.hi.md)
 â€¢ [PortuguÃªs brasileiro readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.pt-br.md)
 â€¢ [Italian readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.it.md)
 â€¢ [Ğ ÑƒÑÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.ru.md)
 â€¢ [Indonesian readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.id.md)
 â€¢ [ÙØ§Ø±Ø³ÛŒ readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.fa.md)
 â€¢ [TÃ¼rkÃ§e readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.tr.md)
 â€¢ [Polskie readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.pl.md)


Rich is a Python library for _rich_ text and beautiful formatting in the terminal.

The [Rich API](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) makes it easy to add color and style to terminal output. Rich can also render pretty tables, progress bars, markdown, syntax highlighted source code, tracebacks, and more â€” out of the box.

![Features](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/features.png)

For a video introduction to Rich see [calmcode.io](https://calmcode.io/rich/introduction.html) by [@fishnets88](https://twitter.com/fishnets88).

See what [people are saying about Rich](https://www.willmcgugan.com/blog/pages/post/rich-tweets/).

## Compatibility

Rich works with Linux, macOS and Windows. True color / emoji works with new Windows Terminal, classic terminal is limited to 16 colors. Rich requires Python 3.8 or later.

Rich works with [Jupyter notebooks](https://jupyter.org/) with no additional configuration required.

## Installing

Install with `pip` or your favorite PyPI package manager.

```sh
python -m pip install rich
```

Run the following to test Rich output on your terminal:

```sh
python -m rich
```

## Rich Print

To effortlessly add rich output to your application, you can import the [rich print](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/introduction.html#quick-start) method, which has the same signature as the builtin Python function. Try this:

```python
from rich import print

print("Hello, [bold magenta]World[/bold magenta]!", ":vampire:", locals())
```

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/print.png)

## Rich REPL

Rich can be installed in the Python REPL, so that any data structures will be pretty printed and highlighted.

```python
>>> from rich import pretty
>>> pretty.install()
```

![REPL](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/repl.png)

## Using the Console

For more control over rich terminal content, import and construct a [Console](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console) object.

```python
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
```

The Console object has a `print` method which has an intentionally similar interface to the builtin `print` function. Here's an example of use:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!")
```

As you might expect, this will print `"Hello World!"` to the terminal. Note that unlike the builtin `print` function, Rich will word-wrap your text to fit within the terminal width.

There are a few ways of adding color and style to your output. You can set a style for the entire output by adding a `style` keyword argument. Here's an example:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!", style="bold red")
```

The output will be something like the following:

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/hello_world.png)

That's fine for styling a line of text at a time. For more finely grained styling, Rich renders a special markup which is similar in syntax to [bbcode](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBCode). Here's an example:

```python
console.print("Where there is a [bold cyan]Will[/bold cyan] there [u]is[/u] a [i]way[/i].")
```

![Console Markup](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/where_there_is_a_will.png)

You can use a Console object to generate sophisticated output with minimal effort. See the [Console API](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/console.html) docs for details.

## Rich Inspect

Rich has an [inspect](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/init.html?highlight=inspect#rich.inspect) function which can produce a report on any Python object, such as class, instance, or builtin.

```python
>>> my_list = ["foo", "bar"]
>>> from rich import inspect
>>> inspect(my_list, methods=True)
```

![Log](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/inspect.png)

See the [inspect docs](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/init.html#rich.inspect) for details.

# Rich Library

Rich contains a number of builtin _renderables_ you can use to create elegant output in your CLI and help you debug your code.

Click the following headings for details:

<details>
<summary>Log</summary>

The Console object has a `log()` method which has a similar interface to `print()`, but also renders a column for the current time and the file and line which made the call. By default Rich will do syntax highlighting for Python structures and for repr strings. If you log a collection (i.e. a dict or a list) Rich will pretty print it so that it fits in the available space. Here's an example of some of these features.

```python
from rich.console import Console
console = Console()

test_data = [
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "sum", "params": [None, 1, 2, 4, False, True], "id": "1",},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "notify_hello", "params": [7]},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "subtract", "params": [42, 23], "id": "2"},
]

def test_log():
    enabled = False
    context = {
        "foo": "bar",
    }
    movies = ["Deadpool", "Rise of the Skywalker"]
    console.log("Hello from", console, "!")
    console.log(test_data, log_locals=True)


test_log()
```

The above produces the following output:

![Log](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/log.png)

Note the `log_locals` argument, which outputs a table containing the local variables where the log method was called.

The log method could be used for logging to the terminal for long running applications such as servers, but is also a very nice debugging aid.

</details>
<details>
<summary>Logging Handler</summary>

You can also use the builtin [Handler class](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/logging.html) to format and colorize output from Python's logging module. Here's an example of the output:

![Logging](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/logging.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Emoji</summary>

To insert an emoji in to console output place the name between two colons. Here's an example:

```python
>>> console.print(":smiley: :vampire: :pile_of_poo: :thumbs_up: :raccoon:")
ğŸ˜ƒ ğŸ§› ğŸ’© ğŸ‘ ğŸ¦
```

Please use this feature wisely.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tables</summary>

Rich can render flexible [tables](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tables.html) with unicode box characters. There is a large variety of formatting options for borders, styles, cell alignment etc.

![table movie](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table_movie.gif)

The animation above was generated with [table_movie.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/table_movie.py) in the examples directory.

Here's a simpler table example:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.table import Table

console = Console()

table = Table(show_header=True, header_style="bold magenta")
table.add_column("Date", style="dim", width=12)
table.add_column("Title")
table.add_column("Production Budget", justify="right")
table.add_column("Box Office", justify="right")
table.add_row(
    "Dec 20, 2019", "Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker", "$275,000,000", "$375,126,118"
)
table.add_row(
    "May 25, 2018",
    "[red]Solo[/red]: A Star Wars Story",
    "$275,000,000",
    "$393,151,347",
)
table.add_row(
    "Dec 15, 2017",
    "Star Wars Ep. VIII: The Last Jedi",
    "$262,000,000",
    "[bold]$1,332,539,889[/bold]",
)

console.print(table)
```

This produces the following output:

![table](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table.png)

Note that console markup is rendered in the same way as `print()` and `log()`. In fact, anything that is renderable by Rich may be included in the headers / rows (even other tables).

The `Table` class is smart enough to resize columns to fit the available width of the terminal, wrapping text as required. Here's the same example, with the terminal made smaller than the table above:

![table2](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table2.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Progress Bars</summary>

Rich can render multiple flicker-free [progress](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/progress.html) bars to track long-running tasks.

For basic usage, wrap any sequence in the `track` function and iterate over the result. Here's an example:

```python
from rich.progress import track

for step in track(range(100)):
    do_step(step)
```

It's not much harder to add multiple progress bars. Here's an example taken from the docs:

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/progress.gif)

The columns may be configured to show any details you want. Built-in columns include percentage complete, file size, file speed, and time remaining. Here's another example showing a download in progress:

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/downloader.gif)

To try this out yourself, see [examples/downloader.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/downloader.py) which can download multiple URLs simultaneously while displaying progress.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Status</summary>

For situations where it is hard to calculate progress, you can use the [status](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console.status) method which will display a 'spinner' animation and message. The animation won't prevent you from using the console as normal. Here's an example:

```python
from time import sleep
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
tasks = [f"task {n}" for n in range(1, 11)]

with console.status("[bold green]Working on tasks...") as status:
    while tasks:
        task = tasks.pop(0)
        sleep(1)
        console.log(f"{task} complete")
```

This generates the following output in the terminal.

![status](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/status.gif)

The spinner animations were borrowed from [cli-spinners](https://www.npmjs.com/package/cli-spinners). You can select a spinner by specifying the `spinner` parameter. Run the following command to see the available values:

```
python -m rich.spinner
```

The above command generates the following output in the terminal:

![spinners](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/spinners.gif)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tree</summary>

Rich can render a [tree](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tree.html) with guide lines. A tree is ideal for displaying a file structure, or any other hierarchical data.

The labels of the tree can be simple text or anything else Rich can render. Run the following for a demonstration:

```
python -m rich.tree
```

This generates the following output:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/tree.png)

See the [tree.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/tree.py) example for a script that displays a tree view of any directory, similar to the linux `tree` command.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Columns</summary>

Rich can render content in neat [columns](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/columns.html) with equal or optimal width. Here's a very basic clone of the (MacOS / Linux) `ls` command which displays a directory listing in columns:

```python
import os
import sys

from rich import print
from rich.columns import Columns

directory = os.listdir(sys.argv[1])
print(Columns(directory))
```

The following screenshot is the output from the [columns example](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/columns.py) which displays data pulled from an API in columns:

![columns](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/columns.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Markdown</summary>

Rich can render [markdown](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/markdown.html) and does a reasonable job of translating the formatting to the terminal.

To render markdown import the `Markdown` class and construct it with a string containing markdown code. Then print it to the console. Here's an example:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.markdown import Markdown

console = Console()
with open("README.md") as readme:
    markdown = Markdown(readme.read())
console.print(markdown)
```

This will produce output something like the following:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/markdown.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Syntax Highlighting</summary>

Rich uses the [pygments](https://pygments.org/) library to implement [syntax highlighting](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/syntax.html). Usage is similar to rendering markdown; construct a `Syntax` object and print it to the console. Here's an example:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.syntax import Syntax

my_code = '''
def iter_first_last(values: Iterable[T]) -> Iterable[Tuple[bool, bool, T]]:
    """Iterate and generate a tuple with a flag for first and last value."""
    iter_values = iter(values)
    try:
        previous_value = next(iter_values)
    except StopIteration:
        return
    first = True
    for value in iter_values:
        yield first, False, previous_value
        first = False
        previous_value = value
    yield first, True, previous_value
'''
syntax = Syntax(my_code, "python", theme="monokai", line_numbers=True)
console = Console()
console.print(syntax)
```

This will produce the following output:

![syntax](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/syntax.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tracebacks</summary>

Rich can render [beautiful tracebacks](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/traceback.html) which are easier to read and show more code than standard Python tracebacks. You can set Rich as the default traceback handler so all uncaught exceptions will be rendered by Rich.

Here's what it looks like on OSX (similar on Linux):

![traceback](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/traceback.png)

</details>

All Rich renderables make use of the [Console Protocol](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/protocol.html), which you can also use to implement your own Rich content.

# Rich CLI


See also [Rich CLI](https://github.com/textualize/rich-cli) for a command line application powered by Rich. Syntax highlight code, render markdown, display CSVs in tables, and more, directly from the command prompt.


![Rich CLI](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Textualize/rich-cli/main/imgs/rich-cli-splash.jpg)

# Textual

See also Rich's sister project, [Textual](https://github.com/Textualize/textual), which you can use to build sophisticated User Interfaces in the terminal.

![textual-splash](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4caeb77e-48c0-4cf7-b14d-c53ded855ffd)

Rich to bilbioteka Pythona dla tekstÃ³w _rich_ i piÄ™knego formatowania w terminalu.

[Rich API](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) sprawia, Å¼e dodanie kolorÃ³w i stylÃ³w do wyjÅ›cia terminala jest proste. Rich moÅ¼e rÃ³wnieÅ¼ wyÅ›wietlaÄ‡ Å‚adne tabele, paski postÄ™pu, markdown, podÅ›wietlenie skÅ‚adni kodu ÅºrÃ³dÅ‚owego, Å›lady wsteczne (tracebacki), i jeszcze wiÄ™cej - od rÄ™ki.

![Features](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/features.png)

Wprowadzenie wideo do Richa na [calmcode.io](https://calmcode.io/rich/introduction.html) stworzonym przez [@fishnets88](https://twitter.com/fishnets88).

Zobacz co [inni mÃ³wiÄ… o Richu](https://www.willmcgugan.com/blog/pages/post/rich-tweets/).

## KompatybilnoÅ›Ä‡

Rich dziaÅ‚a na systemach operacyjnych Linux, OSX i Windows. True color / emoji wspÃ³Å‚gra z nowym Terminalem Windows, klasyczny terminal jest ograniczony do 16 kolorÃ³w. Rich wymaga Pythona 3.7 lub nowszego.

Rich dziaÅ‚a z [notatnikami Jupyter](https://jupyter.org) bez potrzeby dodatkowej konfiguracji.

## Instalacja

Zainstaluj z uÅ¼yciem `pip` lub twojego ulubionego menedÅ¼era pakietÃ³w PyPI.

```sh
python -m pip install rich
```

Uruchom komendÄ™ poniÅ¼ej aby przetestowaÄ‡ wyjÅ›cie Rich na twoim terminalu:

```sh
python -m rich
```

## Rich Print

By bezproblemowo dodaÄ‡ wyjÅ›cie rich do twojej aplikacji, moÅ¼esz zaimportowaÄ‡ metodÄ™ [rich print](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/introduction.html#quick-start), ktÃ³ra ma tÄ… samÄ… sygnaturÄ™ jak wbudowana funkcja Pythona. WyprÃ³buj:

```python
from rich import print

print("Hello, [bold magenta]World[/bold magenta]!", ":vampire:", locals())
```

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/print.png)

## Rich REPL

Rich moÅ¼e zostaÄ‡ zainstalowany w REPL, Å¼eby wszystkie struktury danych byÅ‚y Å‚adnie wypisane i podÅ›wietlone.

```python
>>> from rich import pretty
>>> pretty.install()
```

![REPL](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/repl.png)

## UÅ¼ywanie konsoli

Dla wiÄ™kszej kontroli nad bogatÄ… zawartoÅ›ciÄ… terminala, zaimportuj i skonstruuj obiekt [Console](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console).

```python
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
```

Obiekt Console ma metodÄ™ `print`, majÄ…cÄ… celowo podobny interfejs do wbudowanej funkcji `print`. Tu jest przykÅ‚ad uÅ¼ycia:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!")
```

Jak moÅ¼na siÄ™ spodziewaÄ‡ wyÅ›wietli to `"Hello World!"` do terminala. Warto zauwaÅ¼yÄ‡, Å¼e Rich automatycznie zawija tekst, aby mieÅ›ciÅ‚ siÄ™ on w szerokoÅ›ci terminala.

Jest kilka moÅ¼liwoÅ›ci dodania koloru i stylu do wyjÅ›cia terminala. MoÅ¼esz ustawiÄ‡ styl dla caÅ‚ego wyjÅ›cia, dodajÄ…c argument `style`. Na przykÅ‚ad:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!", style="bold red")
```

WyjÅ›cie bÄ™dzie wyglÄ…daÅ‚o tak:

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/hello_world.png)

Jest to w porzÄ…dku dla stylizacji jednej linijki tekstu. Dla dokÅ‚adniejszej stylizacj, Rich wyÅ›wietla specjalny format markup podobny w skÅ‚adni do [bbcode](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBCode). PrzykÅ‚ad poniÅ¼ej:

```python
console.print("Where there is a [bold cyan]Will[/bold cyan] there [u]is[/u] a [i]way[/i].")
```

![Console Markup](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/where_there_is_a_will.png)

MoÅ¼esz uÅ¼yÄ‡ obiektu Console, aby wygenerowaÄ‡ skomplikowane wyjÅ›cie bez problemu. WiÄ™cej informacji odnoÅ›nie Console API w [dokumentacji](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/console.html).

## Rich Inspect

Rich ma funkcjÄ™ [inspect](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/init.html?highlight=inspect#rich.inspect), ktÃ³ra moÅ¼e produkowaÄ‡ raporty na jakimkolwiek obiekcie Python, jak np. klasa, instancja, lub wbudowana funkcja.

```python
>>> my_list = ["foo", "bar"]
>>> from rich import inspect
>>> inspect(my_list, methods=True)
```

![Log](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/inspect.png)

WiÄ™cej informacji na temat funkcji inspect w [dokumentacji](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/init.html#rich.inspect).

## Biblioteka Rich

Rich zawiera wiele wbudowanych _renderables_, ktÃ³re moÅ¼esz uÅ¼yÄ‡ do stworzenia eleganckiego wyjÅ›cia w twoim CLI i pomÃ³c ci w debugowaniu twojego kodu.

Kliknij poniÅ¼sze nagÅ‚Ã³wki, Å¼eby poznaÄ‡ detale:

<details>
<summary>Log</summary>

Obiekt Console ma metodÄ™ `log()`, majÄ…cÄ… podobny interfejs do `print()`, ale wyÅ›wietla rÃ³wnieÅ¼ kolumnÄ™ zawierajÄ…cÄ… aktualny czas oraz plik i linijkÄ™, ktÃ³ra wywoÅ‚aÅ‚a powyÅ¼szÄ… metodÄ™. DomyÅ›lnie Rich podÅ›wietla skÅ‚adniÄ™ dla struktur Pythona i ciÄ…gÃ³w repr. JeÅ›li zlogujesz kolekcjÄ™ (czyli listÄ™ `list` lub sÅ‚ownik `dict`), Rich jÄ… Å‚adnie wypisze tak, Å¼eby zmieÅ›ciÅ‚a siÄ™ w dostÄ™pnym miejscu. PoniÅ¼ej znajduje siÄ™ przykÅ‚ad tych funkcji.

```python
from rich.console import Console
console = Console()

test_data = [
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "sum", "params": [None, 1, 2, 4, False, True], "id": "1",},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "notify_hello", "params": [7]},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "subtract", "params": [42, 23], "id": "2"},
]

def test_log():
    enabled = False
    context = {
        "foo": "bar",
    }
    movies = ["Deadpool", "Rise of the Skywalker"]
    console.log("Hello from", console, "!")
    console.log(test_data, log_locals=True)


test_log()
```

PowyÅ¼szy kod wyÅ›wietla poniÅ¼szy tekst:

![Log](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/log.png)

Istnieje argument `log_locals`, ktÃ³ry wyÅ›wietla tabelÄ™ zawierajÄ…cÄ… zmienne lokalne skÄ…d wywoÅ‚ano metodÄ™  log.

Metoda log moÅ¼e byÄ‡ uÅ¼ywana do logowania do terminala dla dÅ‚ugo dziaÅ‚ajÄ…cych aplikacji takich jak serwery, ale jest rÃ³wnieÅ¼ bardzo dobrÄ… pomocÄ… w debugowaniu.

</details>
<details>
<summary>Handler LogÃ³w</summary>

MoÅ¼esz takÅ¼e uÅ¼yÄ‡ wbudowanej [klasy Handler](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/logging.html), aby sformatowaÄ‡ i pokolorowaÄ‡ wyjÅ›cie z moduÅ‚u logging Pythona. PrzykÅ‚ad poniÅ¼ej:

![Logging](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/logging.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Emoji</summary>

Å»eby wstawiÄ‡ emoji do wyjÅ›cia konsoli, umieÅ›Ä‡ jego nazwÄ™ pomiÄ™dzy dwoma dwukropkami, na przykÅ‚ad:

```python
>>> console.print(":smiley: :vampire: :pile_of_poo: :thumbs_up: :raccoon:")
ğŸ˜ƒ ğŸ§› ğŸ’© ğŸ‘ ğŸ¦
```

Korzystaj z tej funkcji rozsÄ…dnie.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tabele</summary>

Rich moÅ¼e wyÅ›wietlaÄ‡ elastyczne [tabele](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tables.html) ze znakami unicode box. Istnieje duÅ¼a rÃ³Å¼norodnoÅ›Ä‡ opcji formatowania, stylÃ³w, wyrÃ³wnywania komÃ³rek itp.

![table movie](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table_movie.gif)

PowyÅ¼sza animacja zostaÅ‚a wygenerowana z [table_movie.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/table_movie.py) w folderze examples.

PoniÅ¼ej prostszy przykÅ‚ad:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.table import Table

console = Console()

table = Table(show_header=True, header_style="bold magenta")
table.add_column("Date", style="dim", width=12)
table.add_column("Title")
table.add_column("Production Budget", justify="right")
table.add_column("Box Office", justify="right")
table.add_row(
    "Dec 20, 2019", "Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker", "$275,000,000", "$375,126,118"
)
table.add_row(
    "May 25, 2018",
    "[red]Solo[/red]: A Star Wars Story",
    "$275,000,000",
    "$393,151,347",
)
table.add_row(
    "Dec 15, 2017",
    "Star Wars Ep. VIII: The Last Jedi",
    "$262,000,000",
    "[bold]$1,332,539,889[/bold]",
)

console.print(table)
```

Ten kod wyÅ›wietla poniÅ¼szy tekst:

![table](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table.png)

Markup konsoli jest renderowany w ten sam sposÃ³b co `print()` i `log()`. Tak naprawdÄ™ wszystko co moÅ¼e byÄ‡ wyÅ›wietlone przez Richa moÅ¼e byÄ‡ zawarte w nagÅ‚Ã³wkach / wierszach (nawet inne tabele).

Klasa `Table` jest na tyle mÄ…dra, Å¼e zmienia wielkoÅ›Ä‡ kolumn, aby zmieÅ›ciÄ‡ siÄ™ w dostÄ™pnej szerokoÅ›ci terminala, zawijajÄ…c tekst jeÅ›li potrzeba. PoniÅ¼ej ten sam przykÅ‚ad z mniejszÄ… wielkoÅ›ciÄ… terminala:

![table2](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table2.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Paski PostÄ™pu</summary>

Rich moÅ¼e renderowaÄ‡ wiele niemrugajÄ…cych paskÃ³w [postÄ™pu](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/progress.html), aby moÅ¼na byÅ‚o Å›ledziÄ‡ dÅ‚ugo trwajÄ…ce zadania.

Dla podstawowego uÅ¼ycia, owiÅ„ jakÄ…kolwiek sekwencjÄ™ w funkcji `track` i iteruj nad wynikiem. PrzykÅ‚ad poniÅ¼ej:

```python
from rich.progress import track

for step in track(range(100)):
    do_step(step)
```

Nie jest trudniejsze dodanie wielu paskÃ³w postÄ™pu. PoniÅ¼ej przykÅ‚ad z dokumentacji:

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/progress.gif)

Kolumny mogÄ… byÄ‡ skonfigurowane, tak aby wyÅ›wietlaÄ‡ jakiekolwiek detale chcesz. Wbudowane kolumny zawierajÄ… stopieÅ„ ukoÅ„czenia (w %), wielkoÅ›Ä‡ pliku, szybkoÅ›Ä‡ operacji i pozostaÅ‚y czas. PoniÅ¼ej kolejny przykÅ‚ad pokazujÄ…cy pobieranie w toku.

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/downloader.gif)

MoÅ¼esz wyprÃ³bowaÄ‡ tÄ™ funkcjÄ™ samemu, patrz [examples/downloader.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/downloader.py), ktÃ³ry moÅ¼e pobieraÄ‡ wiele URLÃ³w jednoczeÅ›nie, pokazujÄ…c postÄ™p.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Status</summary>

W sytuacjach, gdzie ciÄ™Å¼ko jest wyliczyÄ‡ postÄ™p, moÅ¼na uÅ¼yÄ‡ metody [status](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console.status), ktÃ³ra wyÅ›wietli animacjÄ™ 'spinnera' i wiadomoÅ›Ä‡. Animacja nie przeszkodzi ci w uÅ¼ywaniu konsoli normalnie. PrzykÅ‚ad poniÅ¼ej:

```python
from time import sleep
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
tasks = [f"task {n}" for n in range(1, 11)]

with console.status("[bold green]Working on tasks...") as status:
    while tasks:
        task = tasks.pop(0)
        sleep(1)
        console.log(f"{task} complete")
```

Generuje to nastÄ™pujÄ…cÄ… linijkÄ™.

![status](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/status.gif)

Animacje spinnera zostaÅ‚y zapoÅ¼yczone z [cli-spinners](https://www.npmjs.com/package/cli-spinners). MoÅ¼esz wybraÄ‡ spinnera okreÅ›lajÄ…c parametr `spinner`. Wykonaj nastÄ™pujÄ…cÄ… komendÄ™, aby zobaczyÄ‡ dostÄ™pne wartoÅ›ci:

```
python -m rich.spinner
```

To polecenie generuje nastÄ™pujÄ…cy tekst:

![spinners](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/spinners.gif)\

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tree</summary>

Rich moÅ¼e renderowaÄ‡ drzewo - [tree](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tree.html) zgodnie z wytycznymi. Drzewo jest idealne do wyÅ›wietlania struktury pliku, albo jakiekolwiek inne dane hierarchiczne.

Etykiety drzewa mogÄ… byÄ‡ prostym tekstem albo czymkolwiek innym, co moÅ¼e wyÅ›wietliÄ‡ Rich. Wykonaj poniÅ¼sze polecenie dla demonstracji:

```
python -m rich.tree
```

To polecenie generuje nastÄ™pujÄ…cy tekst:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/tree.png)

W pliku [tree.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/tree.py) znajduje siÄ™ przykÅ‚ad skryptu wyÅ›wietlajÄ…cego widok drzewa jakiegokolwiek folderu, podobnie do linuxowej komendy `tree`.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Kolumny</summary>

Rich moÅ¼e wyÅ›wietlaÄ‡ zawartoÅ›Ä‡ w schludnych [kolumnach](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/columns.html) z rÃ³wnÄ…, lub optymalnÄ… szerokoÅ›ciÄ…. PoniÅ¼ej znajduje siÄ™ bardzo podstawowy klon komendy (MacOSa / Linuxa) `ls`, ktÃ³ra wyÅ›wietla zawartoÅ›Ä‡ folderu w kolumnach:

```python
import os
import sys

from rich import print
from rich.columns import Columns

directory = os.listdir(sys.argv[1])
print(Columns(directory))
```

PoniÅ¼szy zrzut ekranu prezentuje wyjÅ›cie [przykÅ‚adu kolumn](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/columns.py), wyÅ›wietlajÄ…cego dane pobrane z API w kolumnach:

![columns](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/columns.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Markdown</summary>

Rich moÅ¼e renderowaÄ‡ [markdown](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/markdown.html) i wykonuje niezÅ‚Ä… pracÄ™ tÅ‚umaczenia formatowania do terminalu.

Aby wyrenderowaÄ‡ markdown, zaimportuj klasÄ™ `Markdown` i skonstruuj z ciÄ…giem zawierajÄ…cym kod markdown. Potem wydrukuj jÄ… do konsoli. PrzykÅ‚ad poniÅ¼ej:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.markdown import Markdown

console = Console()
with open("README.md") as readme:
    markdown = Markdown(readme.read())
console.print(markdown)
```

Ten kod wyÅ›wietli tekst w stylu:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/markdown.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>PodÅ›wietlanie kodu ÅºrÃ³dÅ‚owego</summary>

Rich uÅ¼ywa biblioteki [pygments](https://pygments.org/), Å¼eby zaimplementowaÄ‡ [podÅ›wietlanie kodu ÅºrÃ³dÅ‚owego](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/syntax.html). UÅ¼ycie jest podobne do renderowania markdownu; skonstruuj obiekt `Syntax` i wydrukuj go do konsoli. PrzykÅ‚ad poniÅ¼ej:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.syntax import Syntax

my_code = '''
def iter_first_last(values: Iterable[T]) -> Iterable[Tuple[bool, bool, T]]:
    """Iterate and generate a tuple with a flag for first and last value."""
    iter_values = iter(values)
    try:
        previous_value = next(iter_values)
    except StopIteration:
        return
    first = True
    for value in iter_values:
        yield first, False, previous_value
        first = False
        previous_value = value
    yield first, True, previous_value
'''
syntax = Syntax(my_code, "python", theme="monokai", line_numbers=True)
console = Console()
console.print(syntax)
```

Ten kod wyÅ›wietli:

![syntax](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/syntax.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tracebacki</summary>

Rich moÅ¼e renderowaÄ‡ [piÄ™kne tracebacki](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/traceback.html), bÄ™dÄ…ce Å‚atwiejsze do czytania i wyÅ›wietlajÄ… wiÄ™cej kodu niÅ¼ standardowe tracebacki Pythona. MoÅ¼na ustawiÄ‡ Richa jako domyÅ›lny handler tracebackÃ³w, Å¼eby wszystkie niewyÅ‚apane wyjÄ…tki (bÅ‚Ä™dy) byÅ‚y renderowane przez Richa.
 â€¢ [Polskie readme](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/README.pl.md)

Rich Ã© uma biblioteca Python para _rich_ text e formataÃ§Ã£o de estilos no terminal.

A [API do Rich](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) permite adicionar cores e estilos no output do terminal de forma fÃ¡cil. Rich tambÃ©m permite formataÃ§ao de tabelas, barra de progresso, markdown, highlight de sintaxe de cÃ³digo fonte, rastreio de erros (traceback) e muito mais.

![FuncÃµes](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/features.png)

Para mais detalhes, veja um vÃ­deo de introduÃ§Ã£o so Rich em [calmcode.io](https://calmcode.io/rich/introduction.html) por [@fishnets88](https://twitter.com/fishnets88).

Veja aqui [o que estÃ£o falando sobre o Rich](https://www.willmcgugan.com/blog/pages/post/rich-tweets/).

## Compatibilidade

Rich funciona no Linux, OSX e Windows. True color / emoji funciona no novo Terminal do Windows, o terminal classico Ã© limitado a 16 cores. Rich requer Python 3.6.3 ou superior.

Rich funciona com [Jupyter notebooks](https://jupyter.org/) sem a necessidade de configuraÃ§Ãµes adicionais.

## InstalaÃ§Ã£o

Instale usando `pip` ou seu gerenciador de pacotes PyPI favorito.

```sh
python -m pip install rich
```

Execute o seguinte comando para testar o output do Rich no seu terminal:

```sh
python -m rich
```

## Print do Rich

Para adicionar as as funÃ§Ãµes de formataÃ§Ã£o do rich na sua aplicaÃ§Ã£o de forma fÃ¡cil, simplesmente importe o metodo [rich print](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/introduction.html#quick-start) que tem a mesma assinatura da funÃ§Ã£o nativa do Python. Por exemplo:

```python
from rich import print

print("Hello, [bold magenta]World[/bold magenta]!", ":vampire:", locals())
```

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/print.png)

## REPL do Rich

O Rich pode ser instalado no REPL do Python fazendo com que qualquer estrutura de dados seja exibida formatada e com highlights.

```python
>>> from rich import pretty
>>> pretty.install()
```

![REPL](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/repl.png)

## Usando o Console

Para ter mais controle sobre a formataÃ§Ã£o do conteudo no terminal, importe e instancie um objeto do [Console](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console).

```python
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
```

Objetos do tipo Console tem um metodo `print` que tem a interface intencionalmente similar Ã  funÃ§Ã£o `print` nativa. Veja a seguir um exeplo de uso:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!")
```

Como esperado, este comando vai imprimir `"Hello World!"` no terminal. PorÃ©m, observe que, diferente da funÃ§Ã£o `print` nativa, o Rich vai quebrar a linha entre palavras (word-wrap) no seu texto para caber na largura do terminal.

Existem algumas formas de adicionar cores e estilos nos outputs. Ã‰ possivel aplicar um estilo para todo output adicionando o argumento nomeado `style`. Por exemplo:

```python
console.print("Hello", "World!", style="bold red")
```

O resultado vai ser algo como:

![Hello World](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/hello_world.png)

Isso funciona bem para formatar cada linha do texto individualmente. Para maior controle sobre a formataÃ§Ã£o, o Rich renderiza um markup especial com uma sintaxe similar ao [bbcode](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBCode). Veja o exemplo a seguir:

```python
console.print("Where there is a [bold cyan]Will[/bold cyan] there [u]is[/u] a [i]way[/i].")
```

![Console Markup](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/where_there_is_a_will.png)

Voce pode usar o objeto do Console para gerar facilmente uma saÃ­da para o terminal sofisticada. Veja a documentaÃ§Ã£o da [API do Console](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/console.html) para mais detalhes.

## Inspect do Rich

O Rich tem uma funÃ§Ã£o [inspect](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/init.html?highlight=inspect#rich.inspect) que gera um relatÃ³rio de qualquer objeto no Python, como classes, instÃ¢ncias ou funÃ§Ãµes nativas.

```python
>>> my_list = ["foo", "bar"]
>>> from rich import inspect
>>> inspect(my_list, methods=True)
```

![Log](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/inspect.png)

Confira a [documentaÃ§Ã£o do inspect](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/init.html#rich.inspect) para mais detalhes.

# A biblioteca Rich

O Rich possui vÃ¡rios _renderizÃ¡veis_ nativos que podem ser usados para criar outputs elegantes no seu CLI e ajudar a debugar o cÃ³digo.

Clique nos itens a seguir para expandir os detalhes:

<details>
<summary>Log</summary>

O objeto Console tem um mÃ©todo `log()` com uma interface similar ao `print()` mas que tambÃ©m imprime uma coluna com a hora atual, nome do arquivo e linha onde foi executado. Por padrÃ£o, o Rich vai fazer highlight de sintaxe para extruturas do Python e para repr strings. Se vocÃª usar o `log()` para imprimir uma _collection_ (por exemplo um dicionÃ¡rio ou uma lista), o Rich vai imprimir formatado de uma forma que caiba no espaÃ§o disponÃ­vel. Veja a seguir alguns exemplos dessas funÃ§Ãµes:

```python
from rich.console import Console
console = Console()

test_data = [
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "sum", "params": [None, 1, 2, 4, False, True], "id": "1",},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "notify_hello", "params": [7]},
    {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "subtract", "params": [42, 23], "id": "2"},
]

def test_log():
    enabled = False
    context = {
        "foo": "bar",
    }
    movies = ["Deadpool", "Rise of the Skywalker"]
    console.log("Hello from", console, "!")
    console.log(test_data, log_locals=True)


test_log()
```

O cÃ³digo acima vai produzir algo parecido com:

![Log](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/log.png)

Note o argumento `log_locals` que imprime uma tabela com as variÃ¡veis locais no contexto em que o mÃ©todo `log()` foi chamado.

O mÃ©todo `log()` pode ser usado para logar no terminal em aplicaÃ§Ãµes de processos longos como servidores, mas Ã© tambÃ©m uma ferramenta Ã³tima para debugar.

</details>
<details>
<summary>Logging Handler</summary>

VocÃª tambÃ©m pode usar a [classe Handler](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/logging.html) nativa para formatar e colorir o output do mÃ³dulo `logging` do Python. Veja aqui um exemplo do output:

![Logging](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/logging.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Emoji</summary>

Para imprimir um emoji no console, coloque o nome do emoji entre dois ":" (dois pontos). Por exemplo:

```python
>>> console.print(":smiley: :vampire: :pile_of_poo: :thumbs_up: :raccoon:")
ğŸ˜ƒ ğŸ§› ğŸ’© ğŸ‘ ğŸ¦
```

Por favor use esse recurso com sabedoria.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Tabelas</summary>

O Rich pode imprimir [tables](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tables.html) flexÃ­veis usando caracteres unicode como bordas. Existem vÃ¡rias opÃ§Ãµes de formataÃ§Ã£o de bordas, estilos, alinhamento das celulas, etc.

![table movie](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table_movie.gif)

A animaÃ§Ã£o acima foi gerada com o arquivo [table_movie.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/table_movie.py) da pasta de exemplos.

Veja um exemplo mais simples:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.table import Table

console = Console()

table = Table(show_header=True, header_style="bold magenta")
table.add_column("Date", style="dim", width=12)
table.add_column("Title")
table.add_column("Production Budget", justify="right")
table.add_column("Box Office", justify="right")
table.add_row(
    "Dec 20, 2019", "Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker", "$275,000,000", "$375,126,118"
)
table.add_row(
    "May 25, 2018",
    "[red]Solo[/red]: A Star Wars Story",
    "$275,000,000",
    "$393,151,347",
)
table.add_row(
    "Dec 15, 2017",
    "Star Wars Ep. VIII: The Last Jedi",
    "$262,000,000",
    "[bold]$1,332,539,889[/bold]",
)

console.print(table)
```

Que gera o seguinte resultado:

![table](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table.png)

Observe que o markup Ã© renderizado da mesma que em `print()` e `log()`. Na verdade, tudo que Ã© renderizÃ¡vel pelo Rich pode ser incluÃ­do nos cabeÃ§alhos ou linhas (atÃ© mesmo outras tabelas).

A classe `Table` Ã© inteligente o suficiente para ajustar o tamanho das colunas para caber na largura do terminal, quebrando o texto em novas linhas quando necessÃ¡rio. Veja o mesmo exemplo a seguir, sÃ³ que desta vez com um terminal menor do que o tamanho original da tabela:

![table2](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/table2.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Barra de Progresso</summary>

O Rich consegue renderizar de forma eficiente mÃºltiplas [barras de progresso](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/progress.html) que podem ser usadas para rastrear o estado de processos longos.

Uma forma simples de usar Ã© passando o iterÃ¡vel para a funÃ§Ã£o `track` e iterar normalmente sobre o retorno. Veja o exemplo a seguir:

```python
from rich.progress import track

for step in track(range(100)):
    do_step(step)
```

Adicionar mÃºltiplas barras de progresso tambÃ©m Ã© simples. Veja outro exemplo que existe na documentaÃ§Ã£o:

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/progress.gif)

As colunas podem ser configuradas pra mostrar qualquer detalho necessÃ¡rio. As colunas nativas incluem a porcentagem completa, tamanho de arquivo, velocidade do arquivo e tempo restante. O exemplo a seguir mostra o progresso de um download:

![progress](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/downloader.gif)

Para testar isso no seu terminal, use o arquivo [examples/downloader.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/downloader.py) para fazer o download de mÃºltiplas URLs simultaneamente, exibindo o progresso de cada download.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Status</summary>

Em casos em que Ã© dificil calcular o progresso da tarefa, vocÃª pode usar o mÃ©todo [status](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/console.html#rich.console.Console.status) que exibe uma animaÃ§Ã£o de um "spinner" e a mensagem. A animaÃ§Ã£o nÃ£o impede em nada o uso do `console`. Veja o exemplo a seguir:

```python
from time import sleep
from rich.console import Console

console = Console()
tasks = [f"task {n}" for n in range(1, 11)]

with console.status("[bold green]Working on tasks...") as status:
    while tasks:
        task = tasks.pop(0)
        sleep(1)
        console.log(f"{task} complete")
```

Este cÃ³digo resultarÃ¡ no seguinte output no terminal:

![status](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/status.gif)

As animaÃ§Ãµes do "spinner" foram emprestadas do [cli-spinners](https://www.npmjs.com/package/cli-spinners). Ã‰ possÃ­vel escolher um estilo de "spinner" usando o parametro `spinner`. Execute o comando a seguir para ver todos os tipos de "spinner" disponÃ­veis.

```
python -m rich.spinner
```

O comando acima deve exibir o seguinte no seu terminal:

![spinners](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/spinners.gif)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Ãrvore</summary>

O Rich pode renderizar [Ã¡rvores](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tree.html) com linhas de identaÃ§Ã£o. Uma Ã¡rvore Ã© a forma ideal de exibir uma estrutura de arquivos ou qualquer outra apresentaÃ§Ã£o hierÃ¡rquica de dados.

Os titulos dos itens da Ã¡rvore podem ser textos simples ou qualquer coisa que o Rich pode renderizar. Execute o comando a seguir para uma demonstraÃ§Ã£o:

```
python -m rich.tree
```

Isso gera o seguinte resultado:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/tree.png)

Veja o exemplo em [tree.py](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/tree.py) de um cÃ³digo que gera uma Ã¡rvore de exibiÃ§Ã£o de um dicionÃ¡rio, semelhante ao comando `tree` do linux.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Colunas</summary>

O Rich pode renderizar conteÃºdos em [colunas](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/columns.html) bem formatadas com tamanhos iguais ou otimizados. O exemplo a seguir Ã© uma cÃ³pia bÃ¡sica do comando `ls` (presente no MacOS / Linux) que mostra o conteÃºdo de uma pasta organizado em colunas:

```python
import os
import sys

from rich import print
from rich.columns import Columns

directory = os.listdir(sys.argv[1])
print(Columns(directory))
```

O screenshot a seguir Ã© do resultado do [exemplo de colunas](https://github.com/textualize/rich/blob/master/examples/columns.py) formatando em colunas os dados extraÃ­dos de uma API:

![columns](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/columns.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Markdown</summary>

O Rich pode renderizar [markdown](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/markdown.html) e faz um bom trabalho de conversÃ£o do formato para o terminal.

Para renderizar markdown, importe a classe `Markdown` e instancie com a string que contÃ©m o cÃ³digo markdown. Depois, imprima o objeto no console. Por exemplo:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.markdown import Markdown

console = Console()
with open("README.md") as readme:
    markdown = Markdown(readme.read())
console.print(markdown)
```

Isso produzirÃ¡ um resultado como:

![markdown](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/markdown.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Highlight de Sintaxe</summary>

O Rich usa a biblioteca [pygments](https://pygments.org/) para implementar o [highlight de sintaxe](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/syntax.html). O uso Ã© similar Ã  renderizaÃ§Ã£o de markdown, instancie um objeto da classe `Syntax` imprima no console. Por exemplo:

```python
from rich.console import Console
from rich.syntax import Syntax

my_code = '''
def iter_first_last(values: Iterable[T]) -> Iterable[Tuple[bool, bool, T]]:
    """Iterate and generate a tuple with a flag for first and last value."""
    iter_values = iter(values)
    try:
        previous_value = next(iter_values)
    except StopIteration:
        return
    first = True
    for value in iter_values:
        yield first, False, previous_value
        first = False
        previous_value = value
    yield first, True, previous_value
'''
syntax = Syntax(my_code, "python", theme="monokai", line_numbers=True)
console = Console()
console.print(syntax)
```

Este cÃ³digo gerarÃ¡ o seguinte resultado:

![syntax](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/syntax.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Rastreio de Erros (tracebacks)</summary>

O Rich renderiza [tracebacks formatados](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/traceback.html) que sÃ£o fÃ¡ceis de ler e mostra mais cÃ³digo do que os tracebacks padrÃ£o do Python. Ã‰ possivel configurar o Rich como o gerenciador padrÃ£o de tracebacks para que todas as excessÃµes inesperadas sejam renderizadas pelo Rich.

Veja o resultado disso no OSX (resultados semelhantes no Linux):

![traceback](https://github.com/textualize/rich/raw/master/imgs/traceback.png)

</details>

Todos os renderizÃ¡veis do Rich usam o [Protocolo do Console](https://rich.readthedocs.io/en/latest/protocol.html), que vocÃª pode usar para implementar o seu prÃ³prio conteÃºdo Rich.

# Rich para empresas

DisponÃ­vel como parte da assinatura Tidelift.

Os mantenedores do Rich e milhares de outros pacotes estÃ£o trabalhando com o Tidelift para disponibilizar suporte comercial e manutenÃ§Ã£o de projetos de cÃ³digo aberto usados nas suas aplicaÃ§Ãµes. Economize tempo, reduza riscos e melhore a qualidade do cÃ³digo enquanto paga os mantenedores dos pacotes exatos que vocÃª usa. [Mais detalhes.](https://tidelift.com/subscription/pkg/pypi-rich?utm_source=pypi-rich&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=enterprise&utm_term=repo)

# Projetos usando Rich

Aqui estÃ£o alguns projetos que usam o Rich:

- [BrancoLab/BrainRender](https://github.com/BrancoLab/BrainRender)
  a python package for the visualization of three dimensional neuro-anatomical data
  um pacote python para visualisaÃ§Ã£o tridimensional de dados neuro-atÃ´micos.
- [Ciphey/Ciphey](https://github.com/Ciphey/Ciphey)
  ferramenta de descriptografia autoatizada.
- [emeryberger/scalene](https://github.com/emeryberger/scalene)
  um analisador de CPU e memÃ³ria de alta performance e alta precisÃ£o para Python
- [hedythedev/StarCli](https://github.com/hedythedev/starcli)
  Explore projetos de destaque no GitHub pela linha de comando do terminal
- [intel/cve-bin-tool](https://github.com/intel/cve-bin-tool)
  Essa ferramenta verifica a vulnerabilidade de diversos componentes populares (openssl, libpng, libxml2, expat e outros) presentes no seu sistema e alerta para possÃ­veis vulnerabilidades conhecidas.
- [nf-core/tools](https://github.com/nf-core/tools)
  pacote Python com ferramentas auxiliares par a comunidade nf-core.
- [cansarigol/pdbr](https://github.com/cansarigol/pdbr)
  pdb + Rich para auxiliar no debug
- [plant99/felicette](https://github.com/plant99/felicette)
  Imagem de satÃ©lites para iniciantes.
- [seleniumbase/SeleniumBase](https://github.com/seleniumbase/SeleniumBase)
  Automatize & teste 10x mais rÃ¡pido com Selenium & pytest. Baterias inclusas.
- [smacke/ffsubsync](https://github.com/smacke/ffsubsync)
  Automagicamente sincronize legendas com vÃ­deos.
- [tryolabs/norfair](https://github.com/tryolabs/norfair)
  Biblioteca Python para adicionar rastreio em tempo real de objetos 2D em qualquer detector.
- [ansible/ansible-lint](https://github.com/ansible/ansible-lint) Ansible-lint verifica boas prÃ¡ticas e comportamento que podem ser melhorados.
- [ansible-community/molecule](https://github.com/ansible-community/molecule) Framework de test para Ansible Molecule
- +[Muitos outros](https://github.com/textualize/rich/network/dependents)!
